item.title: Judge says Trump administration must fund SNAP. And, what to know about NYC's election
item.description: Two judges have ordered the Trump administration to fund SNAP benefits. And, New York City voters head to the polls tomorrow to choose between Zohran Mamdani and former Gov. Andrew Cuomo in the mayoral race.

item.title: Gender inequality accelerates Japan's rural depopulation
item.description: Akita Prefecture has Japan's most aged population, lowest birthrate and fastest declining population. Rigid gender roles are prompting young women to leave rural areas like this for opportunities elsewhere.

item.title: In a fraught political moment, one woman finds comfort on her morning commute
item.description: In 2008, when banning same-sex marriage in California was put on the ballot, Kate Elsley's commute changed. Seeing signs supporting the ban became a reminder of what she might not be able to do.

item.title: To optimize health, sync your habits with your body clock. Here's how
item.description: Scientists say the return to "standard time" is good for our health. But the time change can be disruptive and we must also adjust to more winter darkness. Syncing our habits to our body clock helps.

item.title: Trump's National Guard deployments aren't random. They were planned years ago
item.description: President Trump and several others now high up in his second administration have been talking about using the National Guard to help with mass deportations — and possibly invoking the Insurrection Act — for years. Now, those plans might be playing out.

item.title: Mexican mayor killed during Day of the Dead celebrations in Michoacan
item.description: The mayor of the Uruapan municipality, in the western state of Michoacan, was gunned down Saturday night in front of dozens of people who had gathered for Day of the Dead festivities, authorities said.
